etymologies: mid 17th century; earliest use found in Robert Baron (bap. 1630, d. 1658), poet and playwright. From post-classical Latin summulista writer of a short treatise, student of the Summulae Logicales of Petrus Hispanus from summula + -ista

definitions: (A) A student, teacher, or adherent of the Summulae Logicales, a standard textbook on Aristotelian logic written by Petrus Hispanus in the 13th century (b) The author of a summula, or small treatise, especially on logic.
